channel.title: mint on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in mint on Barefoot Rob

item.title: Linux Mint byebye
item.description: 08:30 Saturday 30 May 2015 JST Cinnamon, used by default in Linux Mint, seemed too restrictive in its options. But I guess the worst part: I couldn’t figure out how to open an application without using my mouse. I could press the alt button once, then type the name of the app and see its icon, but not actually activate it. I like how Gnome (Classic), installed by default with my current Debian install disk, will activate the app if I press the enter key.
